title: Holly's Hill 2015 Estate Grenache Blanc (El Dorado)
description: This wine blends rich fruitiness like ripe pear with light oak and almond accents and an appetizingly tangy texture.

title: Il Falchetto 2015 Tenuta Del Fant  (Moscato d'Asti)
description: This fun dessert wine has delicate aromas of citrus, tropical fruit and fragrant white flower. The vivaciously foaming palate offers juicy yellow peach, candied nectarine zest and a hint of thyme. It's sweet, but it also has enough fresh acidity to stop it from being cloying.

title: Illuminati Dino 2013 Illico  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Baking spice, dark berry and fragrant blue flower aromas jump out of the glass. The vibrant, easy-drinking palate offers blackberry, black cherry and star anise alongside supple tannins and firm acidity.

title: Kooyong 2015 Clonale Chardonnay (Mornington Peninsula)
description: Kooyong's entry-level Chardonnay features glimpses of oak in its hints of vanilla, cinnamon and clove, but remains fruit-focused. Vibrant pineapple fruit zips along the palate, ending clean and refreshing.

title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: Dusty apple and peach aromas are mostly pleasant. Chunky and pulpy in feel, this basic Chardonnay tastes of melon and peach. A dry fleshy finish includes a sprinkle of saltiness. Drink now.

title: Five Rows 2015 Marmont Vineyards Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Grapefruit aromas, extroverted fruit flavors and a fresh, crisp mouthfeel make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy.

title: La Valentina 2012 Bellovedere Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Packed in an extremely heavy bottle, this has aromas of French oak, vanilla and coconut. The firm palate offers dried sour cherry, raisin and oak-driven spice alongside raspy tannins that leave and astringent finish. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2015 Bernkasteler Kurfürstlay Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: A hint of smoked nut from nose to finish lends a savory tone to this easygoing off-dry Riesling. Straightforward flavors of pressed apple and pear are sunny and bright. The finish is crisp and refreshing. Drink now.

title: Don Rodolfo 2016 Art of the Andes Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)
description: Slightly briny aromas akin to orange peel open this citric PG. Dry orange flavors are more or less it, while this holds steady and stays fresh across a standard finish.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)
description: This is a Portuguese classic. Made in a structured style, it is dry with plenty of tannins under the fruit. It is a real food wine, with its black-currant flavors firmly under control. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Juvé y Camps 2011 Brut Nature Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)
description: Inoffensive aromas of crushed vitamins and stone fruits are good enough. This feels plump and medium in body, while flavors of papaya and green melon are dry and a touch briny. A solid finish is fine but doesn't push things forward.
designation: Brut Nature Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia

title: Barone Cornacchia 2011 Vigna Le Coste  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of sour cherry, raisin, herb and a hint of scorched earth lead the nose. On the straightforward rather lean palate, ground pepper accents dried cranberry and pomegranate alongside lithe tannins.

title: Martin Ranch 2013 J.D. Hurley Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Fresh and zesty on the nose, this bottling shows dried elderberry fruit laced with oregano, thyme, dill, eucalyptus and black pepper. A strong tobacco flavor shows once sipped, with black-cherry fruit, cedary cigar box and sticky tannins contributing to a leathery mouthfeel.

title: Masciarelli 2015 Villa Gemma  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)
description: Aroma of red berry, pressed purple flower and a whiff of tilled earth lead the nose. The refreshing palate offers crushed blackberry and pomegranate alongside tangy acidity.

title: Ca'nova 2008 San Quirico Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)
description: Aromas of dark berry, French oak and espresso lead the nose. The taut palate offers dried sour cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside bracing, close-grained tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Cantina Valle Tritana 2013 Tritano  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry and a whiff of cooking spice lift out of the glass. The solid straightforward palate offers black currant, dried cherry and clove framed in seasoned tannins.

title: Château Cap l'Ousteau 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: The vines of this estate are in the Médoc village of Lamarque in the Moulis area between Margaux and Saint-Julien. This second wine of Chateau du Cartillon is light and fruity with some black currant flavors along with acidity and a smoky touch. It is a juicy wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.

title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This wine, now mature, is ripe with jammy black fruits. It has soft balanced tannins as well as juicy acidity and a rich aftertaste. It is totally ready to drink.

title: Château des Arnauds 2014  Bordeaux
description: Pure Merlot, ripe and fruity, this wine has only the lightest of tannic structure. That makes for a soft rounded wine from the area close to Lussac Saint-Émilion. Black plum and berry flavors are laced with acidity and finish with a smooth aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Hnos. Pérez Pascuas 2012 Viña Pedrosa La Navilla  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Call this traditional, a throwback, or whatever you want, because it's a less-polished wine with a strong sense of buttery oak and animal. It's also challenging and strained, with herbal tart plum flavors and a strong note of cheesy oak to the finish.

title: Del Rio 2015 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)
description: Fresh and fragrant, with scents and flavors of apple and pear, this moderately fleshy wine has ample acidity to carry it through to a palate-cleansing finish. Hints of minerality add interest.

title: Buena Vista 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This appellation white is light in tart acidity, with a taste of sour lemon that persists on the palate and provides freshness and bite. Concentrated flavors of pineapple ride a creamy texture along a medium-bodied frame.

title: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 531 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: California's Cameron Hughes dips a toe into Oregon waters with this quite drinkable Willamette Valley Pinot. It floats light cherry fruit around some woody, herbal, stiff tannins. There's a nice touch of cinnamon spice ringing through the finish.

title: Silvan Ridge 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Young, tight and crisply defined, this offers peach skin, jicama and cucumber flavors, highlights of gin-like botanicals, and a refreshing, palate-cleansing finish.

title: Vino 2014 Pinot Grigio (Washington)
description: Quite light aromas of apple and flower blossom are followed by sleek fruit flavors. The concentration seems a bit light.

title: Weisinger 2013 Meadowlark Vineyard Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: Pure Syrah, this distinguishes itself from the other 2013 Weisinger reds with clear varietal focus. Red licorice, citrus and mixed red fruits lead into a rather chalky, tannic finish.

title: Yalumba 2014 FSW 8B Botrytis Viognier (Wrattonbully)
description: While some previous vintages have shown more richness and complexity, this is still commendable. A hint of nail polish is a bit distracting, but the toasted coconut aromas and candied pineapple flavors offer plenty to like. Drink now.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Juliénas)
description: The wine has tannins and a stalky black-cherry character. With a firm texture and balanced acidity, the wine is developing although it is not yet ready to drink. Wait until 2017.

title: La Valentina 2013  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Fresh and easygoing, this fruity red has juicy raspberry and black cherry flavors. Hints of clove and pepper add interest while round tannins and bright acidity give it an easy-drinking character.

title: Proud Pour 2014 The Oyster Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Light herb and green-onion aromas lead to crisp lemon and green-apple flavors. The body is light and the texture softly tangy.
